summary: The Guard and Reserve GI Bill Parity Act of 2025 aims to expand eligibility for Post-9/11 Educational Assistance to members of the National Guard. The bill amends Title 38 of the United States Code, specifically Section 3301(1), to include full-time National Guard duty and active duty as qualifying service for educational benefits. The amendments are designed to take effect one year after enactment and apply retroactively to service performed on or after September 11, 2001. It also addresses the application of time limitations for using the entitlement.
